objnote.p: The subject of *Nebuchadnezzar* is derived from the biblical Book of Daniel, 4:31-33. A "voice from heaven" tells the Babylonian monarch that he will "be with the beasts of the field." The prophecy is fulfilled immediately, and Nebuchadnezzar grows "hairs ... like eagles' feathers" and "nails like birds' claws." For Blake, this image probably represented the descent of a mighty ruler, and perhaps all of humanity, into a state of fallen nature.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Nebuchadnezzar, transformed into a nude, beast-like figure with claw-like nails and long, shaggy hair and beard, crawls towards the right but turns his head to face the viewer. His mouth is open and his eyes look down. Spiky, feather-like fur covers part of his body and upper legs. He crawls along grassy ground in front of the trunks of two large trees that lean towards each other.

component.illusobjdesc: Nebuchadnezzar, transformed into a muscular nude, beast-like figure with spiky claw-like nails on his hands and feet and long, shaggy hair and beard, crawls towards the right with his head turned to face the viewer. His long hair cascades over his neck. His hands are on the ground with his fingers together. His right arm is slightly before his left arm. Feather-like fur covers part of Nebuchadnezzar’s torso and his upper right leg; more fur may be visible on his right shoulder. His right leg is extended behind his left leg. His right foot has its toes spread on tiptoe, perhaps digging into the ground. His mouth is open and his eyes are wide and downcast. His expression suggests fear and despair.
The trunks of two large trees lean towards each other behind Nebuchadnezzar. The leaves of the tree on the right are visible above Nebuchadnezzar.
The foreground is covered with grass, moss, lichens, or a mixture of all three. There are dark shadows lower left and to the right of Nebuchadnezzar.
The dark areas upper left and right may be the sky (at night?).
